mapper.select: SELECT user_id userId, class_id classId, apr_yn aprYn, nm snm, birth, phone, email FROM user WHERE role = "ROLE_STD" AND apr_yn = 1 AND class_id = #{classId}
SELECT user_id userId, class_id classId, apr_yn aprYn, nm snm, birth, phone, email FROM user WHERE role = "ROLE_STD" AND apr_yn = 0 AND class_id = #{classId}

SELECT A.result_id resultId, A.`year`, A.semester , A.mid_final mf , B.category_id categoryId, B.nm, A.score, A.rating , A.class_rank cr, A.whole_rank wr FROM aca_result A INNER JOIN subject B ON B.subject_id = A.subject_id WHERE user_id = #{userId} ORDER BY A.semester DESC

SELECT A.result_id resultId, A.`year`, A.mon, B.category_id categoryId , B.nm , A.standard_score sc, A.rating , A.percent FROM mock_result A INNER JOIN subject B ON B.subject_id = A.subject_id WHERE user_id = #{userId} ORDER BY A.mon desc;
mapper.update: UPDATE user SET del_yn = 1 WHERE user_id = #{userId} AND role = "ROLE_TC"
mapper.select: SELECT COUNT(C.class_id) classid FROM van A INNER JOIN school B ON A.school_id = B.school_id INNER JOIN user C ON A.class_id = C.class_id WHERE C.class_id = #{classid} AND C.role ="ROLE_STD" and apr_yn = 1 and del_yn = 0;
SELECT count(user_id) userid FROM user WHERE apr_yn =0 AND class_id = #{classid} AND role = "ROLE_STD";

SELECT COUNT(B.rating) count FROM `user` A INNER JOIN aca_result B ON A.user_id = B.user_id INNER JOIN subject C ON C.subject_id = B.subject_id INNER JOIN sbj_category D WHERE B.rating = #{count} AND A.class_id = #{classid} AND D.category_id = #{categoryid} and D.type =1;
